title-part.text: BRUSHES

reference.text: handles not integral with brushware B25G

note.note-paragraph:
The following IPC groups are not used in the classification scheme. Subject matter covered by these groups is classified in the following groups:
A46B11/02 covered by A46B11/00 or A46B11/0017 or A46B11/0017 or A46B11/002
A46B11/04 covered by A46B11/00 or A46B11/0013

title-part.text: Brush bodies and bristles moulded as a unit
Brushes characterised by the way in which the bristles are fixed or joined in or on the brush body or carrier

CPC-specific-text.text: Bristle carriers and bristles moulded as a unit

title-part.text: by pitch, resin, cement, or other adhesives
by mouldable materials, e.g. metals, cellulose derivatives, plastics
by welding together bristles made of metal wires or plastic materials
by clamping
into rings or the like
specially adapted for paint-brushes
specially adapted for street-cleaning or rail-cleaning brooms
by wires or other anchoring means, specially for U-shaped bristle tufts
the bristles being fixed on or between belts or wires
the bristles being fixed or joined in rubber bodies, e.g. in soft rubber
rubber bristles being fixed in or on brush bodies
Brush bodies
Handles integral with brushware

CPC-specific-text.text: Additional brush head
Brushes with two or more heads on the same end of a handle not intended for simultaneous use
Brushes with two or more heads on the same end of a handle for simultaneous use, e.g. cooperating with each-other
Brushes with heads on opposite sides or ends of a handle not intended for simultaneous use
having articulations, joints or flexible portions
Brushes with elastically deformable heads that change shape during use
Head made of soft plastics, rubber or rubber inserts in plastics matrix
bending or stretching or collapsing
Flexible resilience by plastic deformation of the material
Mechanical joint or hinge, made up of several components
Brushes articulated with more than one hinge
Brushes with a telescopic or similarly moveable portion
designed to allow relative positioning of the head to body
Mechanical joint or hinge made up of several components
being flexible or resilient during use
Flexible resilience by elastic deformation of the material
Inserts made of different material e.g. springs, plates
being adjustable and stable during use
Adjustable and stable shaft or handle, e.g. generally in one piece
Mechanical joint allowing adjustment in at least one plane
Mechanical joint featuring a ball and socket
promoting relative motion during use

reference.text: bristle carriers moving during use A46B7/06; driven brush bodies A46B13/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Removable or interchangeable brush heads

title-part.text: specially shaped for holding by the hand

Grips or handles specially adapted for children
Grips or handles specially adapted for handicapped persons
Grips or handles having a nonslip section
Handles featuring an adjustable thumbrest

title-part.text: shaped as gloves or finger-stalls

CPC-specific-text.text: or other special holding ways e.g. by the tongue

title-part.text: or the like
Bristle carriers arranged in the brush body
in an expanding or articulating manner

where the bristle carrier collapses

title-part.text: interchangeably

CPC-specific-text.text: removable bristle carriers
Clip or snap connection for bristle carriers
Sliding connections for bristle carriers
Threaded or screw connections for bristle carriers
Lock screw to secure carriers

title-part.text: movably during use,

CPC-specific-text.text: i.e. the normal brushing action causing movement

title-part.text: as a rotating disc
as a rotating cylinder
Arrangements of the bristles in the brush body

CPC-specific-text.text: where the brushing material is not made of bristles, e.g. sponge, rubber or paper

title-part.text: Position or arrangement of bristles in relation to surface of the brush body, e.g. inclined, in rows, in groups

CPC-specific-text.text: arranged like in cosmetics brushes, e.g. mascara, nail polish, eye shadow
arranged like in hair brushes, e.g. hair treatment, dyeing, streaking
the bristles or the tufts being arranged in an angled position relative to each other
where the surface of the brush body or carrier is not in one plane, e.g. not flat
Bristle profile, the end of the bristle defining a surface other than a single plane or deviating from a simple geometric form, e.g. cylinder, sphere or cone
Arranged like in or

title-part.text: for toothbrushes

CPC-specific-text.text: specially adapted for cleaning a plurality of tooth surfaces simultaneously

title-part.text: Arrangement of mixed bristles or tufts of bristles, e.g. wire, fibre, rubber

CPC-specific-text.text: the bristles or the tufts being embedded in a different brushing material

title-part.text: Supports or guides for bristles
Adjustable supports
Non-adjustable supports
Brushes with reservoir or other means for applying substances, e.g. paints, pastes, water

CPC-specific-text.text: massage apparatus with liquid delivery A61H7/002, A61H2201/105

reference.text: ; applying liquids or other fluent materials to surfaces by liquid carrying members in general, e.g. by pads B05C1/00, B05D1/28

CPC-specific-text.text: containing only one dose of substance, e.g. single-use toothbrushes
specially adapted to feed the bristle upper surface
with integral reservoirs
dispensing by gravity or by shaking
with pre-pressurised reservoirs, e.g. aerosols
pressurised at moment of use manually or by powered means
with a permanently displaceable pressurising member that remain in position unless actuated, e.g. lead-screw or ratchet mechanisms, toothpaste tube twisting or rolling devices
Lead-screw mechanisms
Means for influencing rotation of the knob, e.g. ratchet, click mechanisms, one way clutches
Means comprising a rachet mechanism or equivalent for advancing the piston stepwise
A piston or plunger advanced by direct pushing along the side of brush handle
Flexible or deformable reservoirs, e.g. resilient bulbs, compressible tubes
where a tube is rolled up transverse to long axis
where a tube is twisted along length
Peristaltic pump
with a reciprocating piston or plunger acting as the pressurising means
with a metered dosage
Brushes where the reservoir is specifically intended for being refilled when empty
Brushes where the reservoir is specifically intended for being replaced when empty
Brushes where the reservoir is specifically intended for solid substance that dissolves gradually
Details
Means integral with the brush for opening, puncturing or piercing sealed reservoirs, e.g. on insertion
Arrangements for preventing undesired leakage or dispensing
Means for closing, sealing or controlling the flow using capillary action
Means for closing or sealing, e.g. toothpaste outlet when brush not in use thereby preventing leakage or drying out
Caps or covers for bristles
Arrangements for catching drips or overflow
Indication of the level of the remaining fluid, e.g. through transparent walls

title-part.text: connected to supply pipe

CPC-specific-text.text: or to other external supply means
by means of a supply pipe
with means for introducing an additive, e.g. soap

title-part.text: with heating means
Brushes with driven brush bodies

CPC-specific-text.text: or carriers
Cylindrical or annular brush bodies
made up of a series of annular brush rings; Annular brush rings therefor
made up of a series of longitudinal strips or segments
formed by winding a strip tuft in a helice about the body
Disc-shaped brush bodies

CPC-specific-text.text: carriers
with means for inducing vibration to the bristles
Brushes which automatically reverse direction of rotation, e.g. using gravity switches

title-part.text: with reservoir or other means for supplying substances
with brush driven by the supplied medium
hand-driven
Other brushes
Brushes with additional arrangements

CPC-specific-text.text: Arrangements for enhancing monitoring or controlling the brushing process
with a controlling means

title-part.text: N: with a controlling brush technique device, e.g. stroke movement measuring device]

CPC-specific-text.text: with means for controlling duration, e.g. time of brushing
with means indicating the remaining useful life of brush
with a pressure controlling device
with a controlling temperature device
with enhancing means
with antistatic properties
with a means for removing or creating static electricity
with an electrical means
with means generating ions
with a magnetic means
with an acoustic means
Enhancing with heat
with protrusion for polishing teeth
with a source of radiation, e.g. UV, IR, LASER, X-ray for irradiating the teeth and associated surfaces
with a lighting means, e.g. laser, bulb
with signaling means
with an acoustic signaling means, e.g. noise
with musical signaling means
with light signaling means
with vibrating signaling means
Drip collector, e.g. collecting the liquids dripping from the brush during a brushing process
Brushes fitted with ventilation means, e.g. with air buffers, air vents
Brushes fitted with ventilation suction, e.g. for removing dust
Brushes combined with other articles normally separate from the brushing process, e.g. combs, razors, mirrors
Brushes fitted with a device for cleaning the ears
Brushes with a comb
with a container for accessories, e.g. pills, polish, condoms, cells
Brushes with a device for opening containers, e.g. shoes polish
Brush with an additional cutting tool, e.g. nail clippers, hair cutting
Brushes fitted with a drinking device, i.e. brushes with devices allowing drinking
Brushes fitted with a interdental devices, e.g. toothpick
Toothbrushes with flossing arrangements
Brushes with an arrangement for using the floss
Brushes with an additional massage device
Brushes fitted with a mirror
Brushes fitted with a rasor or other shaving equipments
Brushes with a scraper, e.g. tongue scraper
Brushes with a shoehorn
Brushes provided with an identification, marking device or design
Brushes with decoration on or in the handle
Brushes with figurines such as animals on the handle
Container, e.g. bag or box with a collection of various devices
Magazins or sets of brushes components, e.g. plurality of brushes linked as a package
Brushes with a feature for storage after use
Self supporting, e.g. brushes that stand upright or in other particular ways

title-part.text: Accessories for brushes
Devices for holding brushes in use
Protective covers for the bristles
Devices for cleaning brushes after use

CPC-specific-text.text: Sterilising brushes; products integral with the brush for sterilising, e.g. tablets, rinse, disinfectant

title-part.text: Other accessories, e.g. scrapers, rubber buffers for preventing damage to furniture
Brushes characterized by their functions, uses or applications
Disposable brush
For human or animal care
Brushes for cleaning the hand or the human body
Brushes for cleaning fingers or finger nails
Brush specifically designed for massaging the skin or scalp
Gum massaging brush i.e. specifically designed for massaging the gums
Brush for applying or spreading shaving foam or soap
Hair brush

Broom
Dusting brush
Household brush, i.e. brushes for cleaning in the house or dishes
Lavatory brush, i.e. brushes for cleaning toilets
Brushes for cleaning cars or parts thereof
Clothes brush, i.e. brushes specifically designed for cleaning clothes

Brushes for polishing
